intro: Nemesia pinnata, commonly known as the common nemesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of 30 to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are borne in racemose inflorescences. Nemesia pinnata thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
